net.proteusframework.core.io

Class UUEncodeInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • net.proteusframework.core.io.UUEncodeInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class UUEncodeInputStream
extends FilterInputStream
    Uudecodes an ASCII byte stream using the base64 method. The input characters are [A-Z][a-z][0-9]+/. No headers or footers are parsed. The uuencode system encodes an 8-bit binary stream into the printable alphanumeric and {+,/,=} characters. Each four characters are decoded into three, resulting in a 25% decrease in size. The unit of decoding is called a word here.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pat B. Double

      • read

        public int read()
         throws IOException
        Reads the next byte of data from the input stream. All non-uuencode characters are ignored. Four bytes are actually read at a time and decoded into three bytes. If four valid bytes cannot be read an IOException is thrown.
        Overrides:
        read in class FilterInputStream
        Returns:
        int - the next byte of data, or -1 if end of stream is reached
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs
